thread.title: UVU volleyball: Dennison tabbed WAC Volleyball Player of the Week
thread.title_full: UVU volleyball: Dennison tabbed WAC Volleyball Player of the Week

title: UVU volleyball: Dennison tabbed WAC Volleyball Player of the Week
text:
Published: Monday, Oct. 12 2015 11:25 a.m. MDT Updated: 2 hours ago Utah Valley sophomore middle blocker Madison Dennison goes for an attack against Seattle U at the PE Building in Orem on Oct. 10. Dennison was named the WAC Volleyball Player of the Week after putting up 11 kills, three blocks and a career-best .846 attack percentage en route to leading UVU to 3-0 victory over the Redhawks. UVU Athletics Enlarge photoÂ» 
  sophomore middle blocker Madison Dennison was named the Western Athletic Conference Volleyball Player of the Week for the week of Oct. 4-11. This is her first WAC Player of the Week honor. 
The Pleasant Grove, Utah, native led the Wolverines to a sweep of Seattle U in their only match last week to propel UVU into sole possession of second place in the WAC standings with a 4-1 league clip. Dennison recorded 11 kills and a match-high three blocks while hitting an error-free match by going 11-for-13 offensively for a career-high .846 attack percentage. Her .846 hitting clip was also good enough to help lead the Wolverines to a season-best .360 attack output as a team en route to the sweep over SU. 
After the stellar performance, Dennison now leads UVU in hitting and ranks fifth in the WAC in the same category with a .325 clip. Dennison also finds herself ranked fifth in the league in blocking (1.05). 
Other nominees included: CSU Bakersfield's Edithza Urias who averaged 3.57 kills on .432 hitting and 1.00 digs per set as the Roadrunners went 1-1 on the week; Elli Woinowsky of Chicago State who averaged 3.00 kills and 3.67 digs; Grand Canyon's Melody Horton who averaged 3.38 kills, 2.25 digs and 0.88 blocks per set as the Antelopes went 1-1 on the week; Sydney Crimmins of Missouri-Kansas City who averaged 4.67 kills on .583 hitting, 1.67 digs and 1.33 blocks per set; NM State's Gwen Murphy who averaged 3.88 kills on .510 hitting and 1.38 blocks per set as the Aggies went 2-0 on the week and Bojana Mitrovic of UT Rio Grande Valley who averaged 5.00 kills and 3.57 digs per set through two matches. 
The second-place Wolverines return to the court on Thursday, Oct. 15, when they travel to Las Cruces, New Mexico, for a date with the first-place New Mexico State Aggies. The contest begins at 7 p.m. MT, and will be streamed live on the WAC Digital Network. James Warnick is an assistant sports information director at  .   about   Recommended Stories
